# Laser Pulse Selector Advance Contract Award Notice
## Solicitation Number
*23_58063*

## General Description
The National Research Council (NRC) of Canada's advance contract award notice (ACAN) is a public announcement of the intention to award a contract for laboratory and scientific equipment. The NRC is seeking a digital oscilloscope with a large memory depth to support photonics and quantum information activities.

## Technical Requirements
The oscilloscope must meet the following minimum specifications:
* Bandwidth: 6 GHz
* Number of channels: 4
* Sample rate: up to 40 Gs/s
* Memory depth: minimum 1 Gpoint per channel, upgradeable to 3 Gpoints per channel
* Digital resolution: 16 bits at 20 Gs/s or 8 bits at 40 Gs/s
* RMS noise floor: 340 uV at 2 mV/div
* Intrinsic timing jitter: 200 fs
* Time base range: 10 ps/div to 10,000 s/div

## Awarded Supplier
The pre-identified supplier for this contract is Rohde & Schwarz Canada, Inc.

## Proposal Submission Opportunity
Supplier firms who consider themselves qualified and available to provide the equipment described in the notice may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to Jonathan Soles, Contracting Authority, by the closing date of October 16th, 2023, at 2:00 p.m. EDT.

## Trade Agreements
This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Revised World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-United Kingdom Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)

## Exemptions and Limits
Exceptions to the Government Contracts Regulations are invoked under subsection 6(d) - "only one person is capable of performing the contract." The procurement is exempt from competition for technical reasons.
